meanings.sent1: She is very employable with her strong work ethic.
meanings.sent2: The candidate's skills and experience make her highly employable.
meanings.sent3: Even the robots found her employable for their team!
meanings.sent4: Her resume was so employable, it practically jumped off the page.
meanings.sent5: His employable qualities shone brightly during the interview.

meanings.sent1: The new machines are employable for various tasks.
meanings.sent2: The material is highly employable for construction purposes.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog seemed more employable in cartoons.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity made her employable in any project she took on.
meanings.sent5: The employable nature of the software impressed the clients.

meanings.definition: Able to find and keep a job.
meanings.sent1: He proved to be very employable by securing a job right after graduation.
meanings.sent2: Being punctual and reliable makes you more employable in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to catch mice made it employable in the barn.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude made her employable in any workplace.
meanings.sent5: The employable skills he learned in training helped him excel in his career.
